Description:
The FHIR Observation resource defines measurements and assertions about a patient, including LDA-W (lines, drains, airways, and wound) data.

This web service cannot write to closed encounters. Ensure that your app doesn't need to write to closed encounters before you begin development.
SampleRequest:
https://hostname/instance-FHIR-Current-Stage1-Primary-Unsecured/api/FHIR/R4/Observation

<Observation>

<extension url="http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/observation-sequelTo">

<valueReference>

<reference value="Observation/ePgszz-JpoXhhBHDW-tMoBw3" />

<display value="FLOQA Line LDA Arm Anterior Left" />

</valueReference>

</extension>

<category>

<coding>

<system value="http://open.epic.com/FHIR/StructureDefinition/observation-category" />

<code value="LDA" />

<display value="Line, Drains, and Airways" />

</coding>

<text value="Line, Drains, and Airways" />

</category>

<code>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.5325.1.7.2.707679" />

<code value="911010659" />

<display value="Output" />

</coding>

<text value="Output" />

</code>

<subject>

<reference value="Patient/eZO66HeGXB6VCJemL-ciSKA3" />

<display value="Meiko Lufhir" />

</subject>

<encounter>

<reference value="Encounter/e.R4dWbUDqF01.Z6BEIfEkZecZklxAhL82tS5wzzlD0o3" />

</encounter>

<effectiveDateTime value="2019-09-05T20:00:00Z" />

<valueQuantity>

<value value="29" />

<unit value="mL" />

<system value="http://unitsofmeasure.org" />

<code value="mL" />

</valueQuantity>

</Observation>
SampleResponse:
HTTP/1.1 201 Created

Cache-Control: no-cache,no-store

Pragma: no-cache

Content-Type: application/xml; charset=utf-8

Expires: -1

Location: Observation/enxsPphZGTNXTDZIieZH1p4mvEXVoWJ9YKNzSbW3DttjBvJ.G3ri-HWxh6nyNqegU3

Server: Microsoft-IIS/8.5

ServerMetrics: {"BlockReads":8,"BlockWrites":25,"BlocksAllocated":4,"DBTime":149,"ECFNetworkTime":1,"ECFRequestCount":0,"ECFRequestTime":150,"GREF":12298,"JournalEntries":38,"LocksFailed":0,"LocksGranted":29,"MCommands":159688,"MemoryDifference":0,"WorkflowEventBlockReads":8,"WorkflowEventDBTime":149,"WorkflowEventECFNetworkTime":0,"WorkflowEventECFRequestCount":0,"WorkflowEventGREF":12298}

X-AspNet-Version: 4.0.30319

X-Powered-By: ASP.NET

Date: Thu, 05 Sep 2019 21:53:20 GMT

Content-Length: 0

category.Name: category
category.Description: "LDA" to create LDA or LDA assessment.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
LOINC code, CADSR code, or encoded flowsheet ID. Either this element or category must be provided, but not both.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

The code element value varies depending upon what is passed (for example, a flowsheet ID vs. a LOINC code). If using a flowsheet ID, the system value is different between Epic organizations, and it is also different between production and non-production environments for the same organization.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
LOINC code, CADSR code, or encoded flowsheet ID. Either this element or category must be provided, but not both.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

The code element value varies depending upon what is passed (for example, a flowsheet ID vs. a LOINC code). If using a flowsheet ID, the system value is different between Epic organizations, and it is also different between production and non-production environments for the same organization.

effectivePeriod.Name: effectivePeriod
effectivePeriod.Description: Start instant and/or end instant of the LDA.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description:
Reference to an encounter resource.

This element can't be modified by Observation.Update.

sequelTo.Name: extension
sequelTo.Description: sequelTo extension that specifies the parent LDA FHIR ID.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Description:
Value of the assessment. For image rows, a comma-delimited list of external DCS IDs is required.

valueQuantity, valueString, valueCodeableConcept, valueTime, and valueDateTime are also accepted.

Observation.Name: Observation
Observation.Description: An instance of the R4 Observation resource.

id.Name: id
id.Description:
The FHIR ID of the newly created observation resource.

Optionally, the client can set the return preference header to "representation", and the server will return the entire resource in a format similar to Observation.Read.
